alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:33AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda and Contra Costa. * WHEN...Until 845 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakland, Berkeley, Richmond, San Leandro, Alameda, San Pablo, El Cerrito, Albany, Pinole, Orinda, Piedmont, Emeryville, Kensington, El Sobrante, Rollingwood, Tara Hills, East Richmond Heigts, East Richmond Heights and Bayview-Montalvin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
